#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Mountaineers ' Climb Up ' for AIDS funding
#Text=Wednesday , April 22 , 2009
#Text=To raise funding and awareness for children living with AIDS in Africa , the tallest mountain peak in every state in the United States will be scaled this spring .
#Text=The American Foundation for Children with AIDS ( AFCA ) , in partnership with the American Alpine Institute , is sponsoring " Climb Up the 50 . "
#Text=Funding from this synchronized climb-a-thon will pay for the uphill battle to support children with AIDS .
#Text=Funds raised will cover AIDS-related medication , supplies , and food for children infected with the disease in the hardest-hit countries , including Kenya , Uganda , and Zimbabwe .
#Text=The program includes Climb Up the 50 , Climb Up the World , and Climb Up Kilimanjaro .
#Text=Climb Up the 50 is based in the United States , with participants climbing or hiking up the highest point in their state sometime during May 23 – 31 .
#Text=Other teams of people will join them to climb the highest peak in their state .
#Text=File : HuffPo Mount Kilimanjaro . jpg
#Text=Mount Kilimanjaro .
#Text=Image : Jim Luce - Huffington Post .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Florida has the lowest peak , with an elevation of only 345 feet above sea level .
#Text=The highest peak in the country is located in Alaska — Denali ( Mount McKinley ) — at over 20,000 feet above sea level .
#Text=A team 's goal is to raise US$ 5,000 for the organization while individuals raise either $ 90 , $ 180 , or $ 360 .
#Text=Climb Up the World
#Text=participants can engage in the event by running , climbing , hiking or cycling — where ever in the world they are — on September 19 or 20 .
#Text=Each person who registers to take part in the event can either raise $ 90 , $ 180 , or $ 360 .
#Text=Each amount is the equivalent of 3 months , 6 months , or one full-year of life-saving medication for a child .
#Text=The $ 25 registration fee covers all administrative costs so all raised donations will be used for AFCA-related programs .
#Text=Teams raise $ 5,000 .
#Text=The Climb Up Kilimanjaro is the most daring event .
#Text=The team consists of 12 brave people who will climb up Mount Kilimanjaro — at 19,330 feet , the highest peak in Africa .
#Text=The Kilimanjaro team wishes to raise $ 10,000 per person to cover costs of climbing and the money needed for the AFCA 's initiatives .
#Text=This 10-day climb will take place September 11 – 24 .
#Text=The mountain climbing apparel manufacturer Merrell has agreed to donate the footwear needed to the 12 members of the Kilimanjaro team .
#Text=File : HuffPo American Foundation for Children with AIDS 1 . jpg
#Text=African children .
#Text=Image : Jim Luce - Huffington Post .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=" AFCA has received tremendous support from the climbing community around the world , " Tanya Weaver , executive director of the AFCA , said .
#Text=" We think the challenge of climbing to the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro is an appropriate symbol for the uphill battle HIV/AIDS children face .

#Text= The organization I founded ten years ago , Orphans International Worldwide , has a community center at the base of Mount Kilimanjaro at OI Tanzania , serving AIDS orphans and other children , " Jim Luce said .

column1: #Text=" Hopefully the Kilimanjaro team will stop by and visit the children currently staying there before they embark on their ten-day journey up the highest peak in Africa .
